verses.original:
नमामीशमीशान निर्वाणरूपं
विभुं व्यापकं ब्रह्मवेदस्वरूपम् ।
निजं निर्गुणं निर्विकल्पं निरीहं
चिदाकाशमाकाशवासं भजेऽहम् ॥ १॥
verses.transliteration:
namāmīśamīśāna nirvāṇarūpaṃ
vibhuṃ vyāpakaṃ brahmavedasvarūpam .
nijaṃ nirguṇaṃ nirvikalpaṃ nirīhaṃ
cidākāśamākāśavāsaṃ bhaje'ham .. 1..

translations.english: I bow to the Ruler of the Universe, whose very form is Liberation, the Omnipresent and All-Pervading Brahma, He who is manifested as the Vedas. I worship Shiva, shining in his own glory, without physical qualities, Undifferentiated, Desireless, All-Pervading Sky of Consciousness and wearing the sky itself as His garment.

verses.original:
निराकारमोंकारमूलं तुरीयं
गिरा ज्ञान गोतीतमीशं गिरीशम् ।
करालं महाकालकालं कृपालं
गुणागारसंसारपारं नतोऽहम् ॥ २॥
verses.transliteration:
nirākāramoṃkāramūlaṃ turīyaṃ
girā jñāna gotītamīśaṃ girīśam .
karālaṃ mahākālakālaṃ kṛpālaṃ
guṇāgārasaṃsārapāraṃ nato'ham .. 2..

translations.english: I bow to You, the Formless One, the very root of Omkara, the Turiya (the fourth state of consciousness), One who is beyond the knowledge of senses. I bow to the Lord of the Mountains (Kailash), the Terrible One (to the wicked), the Destroyer of Time (Death) himself, the Compassionate One, the abode of all virtues, and the One who helps cross the ocean of worldly existence.

verses.original:
तुषाराद्रिसंकाशगौरं गभीरं
मनोभूतकोटिप्रभाश्री शरीरम् ।
स्फुरन्मौलिकल्लोलिनी चारुगङ्गा
लसद्भालबालेन्दु कण्ठे भुजङ्गा ॥ ३॥
verses.transliteration:
tuṣārādrisaṃkāśagauraṃ gabhīraṃ
manobhūtakoṭiprabhāśrī śarīram .
sphuranmaulikallolinī cārugaṅgā
lasadbhalabālendu kaṇṭhe bhujaṅgā .. 3..

translations.english: I bow to Him, who is white like the snow-capped mountains, who is deep and profound, whose body radiates the splendor of ten million Cupids. On whose head the beautiful Ganges ripples, on whose forehead rests the crescent moon, and around whose neck adorns a serpent.

verses.original:
चलत्कुण्डलं भ्रूसुनेत्रं विशालं
प्रसन्नाननं नीलकण्ठं दयालम् ।
मृगाधीशचर्माम्बरं मुण्डमालं
प्रियं शंकरं सर्वनाथं भजामि ॥ ४॥
verses.transliteration:
calatkuṇḍalaṃ bhrūsunetraṃ viśālaṃ
prasannānanaṃ nīlakaṇṭhaṃ dayālam .
mṛgādhīśacarmāmbaraṃ muṇḍamālaṃ
priyaṃ śaṃkaraṃ sarvanāthaṃ bhajāmi .. 4..

translations.english: I worship Shankara, the Beloved Lord of all, with swaying earrings, beautiful large eyes and arched brows, a cheerful face, a blue throat, and who is compassionate. Who wears the skin of a lion (or tiger) and a garland of skulls.

verses.original:
प्रचण्डं प्रकृष्टं प्रगल्भं परेशं
अखण्डं अजं भानुकोटिप्रकाशम् ।
त्रयः शूलनिर्मूलनं शूलपाणिं
भजेऽहं भवानीपतिं भावगम्यम् ॥ ५॥
verses.transliteration:
pracaṇḍaṃ prakṛṣṭaṃ pragalbhaṃ pareśaṃ
akhaṇḍaṃ ajaṃ bhānukoṭiprakāśam .
trayaḥ śūlanirmūlanaṃ śūlapāṇiṃ
bhaje'haṃ bhavānīpatiṃ bhāvagamyam .. 5..

translations.english: I worship the Lord of Bhavani, who is attainable through devotion. He is Fierce, Exalted, Resolute, the Supreme Lord, Indivisible, Unborn, and radiant like ten million suns. He holds the trident and destroys the three kinds of suffering (physical, mental, and spiritual).

verses.original:
कलातीतकल्याण कल्पान्तकारी
सदा सज्जनानन्ददाता पुरारी ।
चिदानन्दसंदोह मोहापहारी
प्रसीद प्रसीद प्रभो मन्मथारी ॥ ६॥
verses.transliteration:
kalātītakalyāṇa kalpāntakārī
sadā sajjanānandadātā purārī .
cidānandasaṃdoha mohāpahārī
prasīda prasīda prabho manmathārī .. 6..

translations.english: O Enemy of Kamadeva (Cupid)! O Lord! Be pleased! Be pleased! You are beyond time (art/attributes), the Embodiment of Auspiciousness, the Cause of the End of the Aeon. You are the Destroyer of the Tripuras, the Giver of eternal bliss to the virtuous, the Concentration of Consciousness and Bliss, and the Dispeller of Delusion.

verses.original:
न यावद् उमानाथपादारविन्दं
भजन्तीह लोके परे वा नराणाम् ।
न तावत्सुखं शान्ति सन्तापनाशं
प्रसीद प्रभो सर्वभूताधिवासम् ॥ ७॥
verses.transliteration:
na yāvad umānāthapādāravindaṃ
bhajantīha loke pare vā narāṇām .
na tāvatsukhaṃ śānti santāpanāśaṃ
prasīda prabho sarvabhūtādhivāsam .. 7..

translations.english: As long as humans do not worship the lotus feet of the Lord of Uma, they will find no happiness, peace, or end to suffering in this world or the next. O Lord who dwells in all beings! Be pleased!

verses.original:
न जानामि योगं जपं नैव पूजां
नतोऽहं सदा सर्वदा शम्भुतुभ्यम् ।
जराजन्मदुःखौघ तातप्यमानं
प्रभो पाहि आपन्नमामीश शम्भो ॥ ८॥
verses.transliteration:
na jānāmi yogaṃ japaṃ naiva pūjāṃ
nato'haṃ sadā sarvadā śambhutubhyam .
jarājanmaduḥkhaugha tātapyamānaṃ
prabho pāhi āpannamāmīśa śambho .. 8..

translations.english: I do not know Yoga, Japa (chanting), or Puja (ritual worship). O Shambhu! I always bow to You. O Lord! Protect me from the burning sorrows of old age and the cycle of birth and death. O Lord Shambhu! I surrender to You! Protect me!

verses.original:
रुद्राष्टकमिदं प्रोक्तं विप्रेण हरतोषये ।
ये पठन्ति नरा भक्त्या तेषां शम्भुः प्रसीदति ॥
verses.transliteration:
rudrāṣṭakamidaṃ proktaṃ vipreṇa haratoṣaye .
ye paṭhanti narā bhaktyā teṣāṃ śambhuḥ prasīdati ..

translations.english: This Rudrashtakam was spoken by the Brahmin (Lomash Rishi) to please Hara (Shiva). Those who recite it with devotion, Lord Shambhu becomes pleased with them.
